entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 12:53PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wildfire Smoke and Air Quality Impacts... * Smoke from the Mosquito wildfire continues to produce unhealthy to hazardous air quality across the region. The latest air quality observations indicate the worst conditions to be concentrated near Truckee and extending into Reno, Sparks, and the North Valleys.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 430 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southwest of Cheyenne Wells, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT FRIDAY NIGHT... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory for northern Klamath and northern Lake counties... in effect through Friday, with a potential to extend the advisory through the weekend. This includes Crater Lake, Chemult, Crescent, Fort Rock, Silver Lake, and Summer Lake.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 15 at 11:37AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PDT FRIDAY... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Quality Advisory...in effect until 1 PM PDT Friday. A Smoke Air Quality Advisory has been issued. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 14 at 11:17AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY FROM THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY FOR Baker County... * WHAT...High concentration of smoke particulates from wildfire smoke. * WHERE...Baker County. * WHEN...Until noon PDT Friday.

entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Rip currents expected. * WHERE...Beaches of Rincon and Aguada. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
